name: enzymes production | enzymes | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/17118/documentation

This activity represents the production of 1 kg of enzymes. In this activity we assume enzymes are produced from potato starch along with a bacterial strain. The bacterial strain is ommited leaving the enzyme production based only on potato starch as input. It is assumed that 4.16 kg of potato starch are needed to produce 1 kg of enzymes (Lages and Tannenbaum 2006). Heat and electricity required for the production are taken as the average of the values reported in Dunn et al. (2012) as inputs for the production of the following three enxymes: Alpha-amylase; Glucoamylase; Cellulase.;Reference(s): ;Dunn et al. 2012. Energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions from enzyme and yeast manufacture for corn and cellulosic ethanol production. Biotechnol Lett. DOI 10.1007/s10529-012-1057-6. ;Ana C. A. Lages, Steven R. Tannenbaum, 2006, Production of Glucose from Tapioca (Cassava Starch) and Farinha de Mandioca (Cassava Meal). Journal of Food Science, DOI: 10.1111/j.1365-2621.1978.tb02474.x;For more information on the model please refer to the dedicate ecoinvent report, access it in the Report section of ecoQuery (http://www.ecoinvent.org/login-databases.html)

The activity starts when the raw materials enter the process.

Materials entering the process are included as well as energy uses, infrastructure and emissions.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The energy data source is dated 2012 referring to 2009 data. This activity is therefore assumed to be valid for the time period from 2009 to 2020.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The majority of production of enzyme is located in Europe, see the production volume comment: 'Li et al. (2012) report in table 3 the location of the main producers of enzymes. Approximately 77% of the market share is covered by producers based in Europe.'. We therefore assume that the RER activity is relevant also as a GLO approximation.;Reference(s):;Li et al. 2012. Technology Prospecting on Enzymes: Application, Marketing and Engineering. Comput Struct Biotechnol J. 2012; 2: e201209017. Published online 2012 Nov 9. doi:  10.5936/csbj.201209017
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This activity represents the production of 1 kg of enzymes. In this activity we assume enzymes are produced from potato starch along with a bacterial strain. The bacterial strain is ommited leaving the enzyme production based only on potato starch as input. It is assumed that 4.16 kg of potato starch are needed to produce 1 kg of enzymes (Lages and Tannenbaum 2006). Heat and electricity required for the production are taken as the average of the values reported in Dunn et al. (2012) as inputs for the production of the following three enxymes: Alpha-amylase; Glucoamylase; Cellulase.;Reference(s): ;Dunn et al. 2012. Energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions from enzyme and yeast manufacture for corn and cellulosic ethanol production. Biotechnol Lett. DOI 10.1007/s10529-012-1057-6. ;Ana C. A. Lages, Steven R. Tannenbaum, 2006, Production of Glucose from Tapioca (Cassava Starch) and Farinha de Mandioca (Cassava Meal). Journal of Food Science, DOI: 10.1111/j.1365-2621.1978.tb02474.x;For more information on the model please refer to the dedicate ecoinvent report, access it in the Report section of ecoQuery (http://www.ecoinvent.org/login-databases.html)
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset is extrapolated from the european dataset. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.

exchanges.description: Enzymes act as catalyst in biochemical reactions.

flow.name: enzymes
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

exchanges.description:
Estimated value. The activity models the average production of enzymes. Heat and electricity are derived from the average of the heat and electricity required for the production of the following three enzymes:Alpha-amylase; Glucoamylase; Cellulase (Dunn et al. 2012).

Reference(s): 
Dunn et al. 2012. Energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions from enzyme and yeast manufacture for corn and cellulosic ethanol production. Biotechnol Lett. DOI 10.1007/s10529-012-1057-6.

exchanges.description:
To produce enzymes, potato starch is needed along with a bacterial strain. For the sake of simplicity the bacterial strain is ommited leaving the enzyme production based only on potato starch as input. It is assumed that 4.16 kg of potato starch are needed to produce 1 kg of enzymes (Lages and Tannenbaum 2006). 

Reference:
Ana C. A. Lages, Steven R. Tannenbaum, 2006, Production of Glucose from Tapioca (Cassava Starch) and Farinha de Mandioca (Cassava Meal). Journal of Food Science, DOI: 10.1111/j.1365-2621.1978.tb02474.x
